message.content:
cs.CG, cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.GR, cs.SC. 

The paper deals with preprocessing a planar subdivision for point-location queries, which is a fundamental problem in computational geometry. The use of distance from the query point to the boundary of the polygon, as well as the decomposition of regions into convex quadrilaterals and triangles, suggests that the paper is likely to be classified under cs.CG (Computational Geometry) or cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms). The consideration of probabilities γ_i and the use of logarithmic terms in the query time suggest that the paper may also be relevant to cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics) and cs.SC (Symbolic Computation). Finally, the mention of a simpler solution for the special case of a subdivision of the unit square suggests that the paper may also be relevant to cs.GR (Graphics).
